thing-type.label: ZMNHAD Flush 1 relay
thing-type.description: Flush 1 relay<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThis Z-Wave module is used for switching on or off the electrical device (e.g. light or fan). The module can be controlled either through Z-wave network or through the wall switch. The module is designed to be mounted inside a “flush mounting box”, hidden behind a traditional wall switch. Module measures power consumption of electrical device and supports connection of digital temperature sensor. It is designed to act as repeater in order to improve range and stability of Z-wave network. Supported switches Module supports mono-stable switches (push button) and bi-stable switches. The module is factory set to operate with bi-stable switches.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gt<b&gtModule Inclusion (Adding to Z-Wave network)</b&gt</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtConnect module to power supply (with temperature sensor connected -if purchased)</li&gt <li&gtEnable add/remove mode on main controller</li&gt <li&gtAuto-inclusion (works forabout 5 seconds after connected to power supply) or</li&gt <li&gtPress push button I1 three times within 3s (3 times change switch state within 3 seconds) or</li&gt <li&gtPress service button <b&gtS</b&gt (only applicable for 24 V SELV supply voltage) for more than 2 seconds.</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNOTE1:</strong&gt For auto-inclusion procedure, first set main controller into inclusion mode and then connect module to power supply.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE2:</strong&gt When connecting temperature sensor to module that has already been included, you have to exclude module first. Switch off power supply , connect the sensor and re-include the module.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gt<b&gtModule Exclusion/Reset (Removing from Z-Wavenetwork)</b&gt</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtConnect module to power supply</li&gt <li&gtBring module within maximum 1 meter (3 feet) of the main controller,</li&gt <li&gtEnable add/remove mode on main controller,</li&gt <li&gtPress push button <b&gtI1 </b&gtfive times within 3s (5 times change switch state within 3 seconds) in the first 60 seconds after the module is connected to the power supply or</li&gt <li&gtPress service button <b&gtS </b&gt(only applicable for 24 V SELV supply voltage) for more than 6 seconds.</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtBy this function all parameters of the module are set to default values and own ID is deleted.</p&gt <p&gtIf push button I1 is pressed three times within 3s (or service button S is pressed more than 2 and less than 6 seconds) module is excluded, but configuration parameters are not set to default values.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Input 1 switch type
parameter.description: Input 1 switch type

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Input 2 contact type
parameter.description: Input 2 contact type

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Input 3 contact type
parameter.description: Input 3 contact type

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: Activate /deactivate ALL ON/ALL OFF
parameter.description: module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF

options.option: ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF active

parameter.name: config_11_2
parameter.label: 11: Automatic turning off relay after set time
parameter.description: When relay goes automatically OFF after this time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhen relay is ON it goes automatically OFF after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive ON command regardless from where it comes (push button, associated module, controller,..)</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 = disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 - 32535 = time in units determined by parameter 15</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: Automatic turning on relay after set time
parameter.description: When relay goes automatically ON after this time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhen relay is OFF it goes automatically ON after time defined by this parameter.Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive OFF command regardless from where it comes(push button, associated module, controller,..</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 - Auto ON disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 - 32535 time in units determined by parameter 15</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: Automatic switching units selection
parameter.description: NOTE: Parameter is the same for turning OFF or ON.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAutomatic turning off / on seconds or milliseconds selection</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_1
parameter.label: 30: Save the relay state after a power failure
parameter.description: Save the relay state after a power failure

options.option: Module saves its state before power failure
Module stays OFF after a power failure

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: Power reporting in Watts on power change
parameter.description: Power reporting in Watts on power change<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gt0 – Reporting Disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 – 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtPower report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt if power changed is less than 1W, the report is not send (pushed), independent of percentage set</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_42_2
parameter.label: 42: Power reporting in Watts by Time interval
parameter.description: Set value means time interval when power report is send<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet value means time interval (0 – 32535) in seconds, when power report is send.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtDefault value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s)</li&gt <li&gt0 – Reporting Disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 – 32535 = 1second – 32535 seconds.</li&gt <li&gtReporting enabled. Power report is send with time </li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_63_1
parameter.label: 63: Output Switch selection
parameter.description: Set the type of the device connected to the output. (NO) / (NC)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtControls the active state of the output switch.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt Normally Open (NO), load is not connected to power when inactive (“off”). </li&gt <li&gtNormally Closed (NC), load is connected to power when inactive (“off”), the inverse of usual operation.</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_100_1
parameter.label: 100: Endpoints I2 Notification Type and Event
parameter.description: Enable / Disable Endpoints I2 or select Notification Type and Event<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnabling I2 means that Endpoint (I2) will be present on UI.</p&gt <p&gtDisabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value.</p&gt <p&gtAdditionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint. </p&gt <h1&gt<strong&gtNOTE</strong&gt:</h1&gt <p&gt<strong&gtAfter parameter change, module has to be re included into the network in order setting to take effect! </strong&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_101_1
parameter.label: 101: Endpoints I3 Notification Type and Event
parameter.description: Enable / Disable Endpoints I3 or select Notification Type and Event<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnabling I3 means that Endpoint (I3) will be present on UI.</p&gt <p&gtDisabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value.</p&gt <p&gtAdditionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint</p&gt <h1&gtNOTE:</h1&gt <p&gt<strong&gtAfter parameter change, module has to be re included into the network in order setting to take effect!</strong&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_110_2
parameter.label: 110: Temperature sensor offset settings
parameter.description: Temperature sensor offset settings<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt default value 32536</li&gt <li&gt32536 – offset is 0.0C - From 1 to 100–value from 0.1°C to 10.0°C is added to actual measured temperature.</li&gt <li&gtFrom 1001 to 1100 – value from -0.1 °C to -10.0 °C is subtracted to actual measured temperature</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_120_1
parameter.label: 120: Digital temperature sensor reporting
parameter.description: Digital temperature sensor reporting<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 5 = 0,5°C</li&gt <li&gt0 – Reporting disabled</li&gt <li&gt1- 127 = 0,1°C – 12,7°C, step is 0,1°C</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: Lifeline group (reserved for communication with the main controller)

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Basic on/off (triggered input Q state)
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtbasic on/off (triggered at change of the output Q state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Basic on/off (triggered input I2 state)
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt basic on/off (triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_4
parameter.label: 4: Notification report (triggered input I2 state)
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtNotification report (triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_5
parameter.label: 5: Binary Sensor (triggered input I2 state)
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt Binary sensor (triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_6
parameter.label: 6: Basic on/off (triggered input I3 state)
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt basic on/off (triggered at change of the input I3 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes</p&gt

parameter.name: group_7
parameter.label: 7: Notification report (triggered input I3 state)
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtnotification report (triggered at change of the input I3 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_8
parameter.label: 8: Binary Sensor report (triggered input I3 state)
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt binary sensor report (triggered at change of the input I3 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes</p&gt

parameter.name: group_9
parameter.label: 9: Multilevel Sensor report (triggered temperature)
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt multilevel sensor report (triggered at change of temperature sensor) up to 16 nodes</p&gt
